title: Rose Day greeting app (splash + greeting + falling roses)

requirements.summary: Add a full-screen splash screen with an English ‚ÄúTap to enter‚Äù call-to-action that transitions to the main greeting view via click/tap and accessible keyboard activation.
acceptanceCriteria: App loads on the splash page by default.
Splash page shows an English "Tap to enter" style call-to-action.
User can enter via click/tap; optionally Enter/Space also works for accessibility.
After entering, the user sees the main greeting page.
No console errors from event handlers or navigation logic.

file_operations.description: Create the app-level view switch (splash -> main) using React state so the splash screen is the initial default view without changing frontend/src/main.tsx; ensure activation works via click/tap and Enter/Space for accessibility.
Implement the full-screen SplashPage UI with a clear English ‚ÄúTap to enter‚Äù prompt and accessible semantics (focusable container/button role, keyboard handling).

requirements.summary: Implement the main Rose Day greeting page UI matching the provided design (radial gradient background, glassmorphism card, exact text, floating rose emoji row).
acceptanceCriteria: Main page background uses a radial gradient similar to the provided colors (#ffc0cb to #7a0019).
A centered card is rendered with translucent background, blur (glass effect), rounded corners, padding, and a soft shadow.
Text content matches the provided wording and line breaks (English).
Three rose emojis are shown in a row and have a gentle floating animation.
Layout is responsive and remains centered on common mobile and desktop sizes.

file_operations.description: Create the main greeting page with the radial pink-to-deep-maroon gradient background and a centered glassmorphism card containing: heading ‚ÄúHappy Rose Day üåπ‚Äù, name ‚ÄúJayasri‚Äù, a row of 3 rose emojis, the message ‚ÄúJust a small rose, to brighten your day a little üå∏‚Äù, and footer ‚Äú‚Äì from someone who admires you‚Äù; use Tailwind classes for layout and responsiveness.

Add Tailwind layers and scoped CSS utilities/classes for the gentle floating emoji animation (used by the 3-rose row) and any small global typography tweaks needed for the design (avoid inline <style> blocks).
Wire RoseDayPage as the post-splash view so that after activation on SplashPage the user sees the main greeting page.

requirements.summary: Implement a React falling rose emoji animation that spawns, animates, and removes roses with proper cleanup to prevent memory leaks.
acceptanceCriteria: Falling rose emojis appear continuously while on the main greeting page.
Each falling rose has randomized x-position and randomized fall duration similar to the original (roughly 4‚Äì7 seconds).
Falling roses are removed from the DOM/state after completing (no unbounded growth).
All timers/intervals are cleaned up when leaving/unmounting the main page.
Animation runs smoothly without significant jank on typical devices.

file_operations.description: Create a FallingRoses React component that periodically spawns rose emoji elements at random horizontal positions and randomized 4‚Äì7s animation duration, animates them falling + rotating, and removes each rose after its animation completes; ensure all intervals/timeouts are cleaned up on unmount.

Add keyframes/classes for the falling + rotating rose animation (e.g., fall from above viewport to below viewport while rotating), designed to accept per-element CSS variables/inline style values for duration/position while keeping the animation definition in CSS.
Mount FallingRoses only on the main greeting page so the animation runs while viewing the greeting and automatically stops/cleans up when leaving the page.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent warm, romantic Rose Day theme across splash and main views using Tailwind and scoped styles (no blue/purple primary palette).
acceptanceCriteria: Splash and main pages share a consistent warm/pink/rose-toned theme.
Typography visually matches the intended feel (e.g., serif display for heading + clean sans for body) without relying on inline HTML <style> blocks.
No primary blue/purple theme elements are introduced.
UI looks intentional and consistent rather than default-styled.

file_operations.description: Define consistent warm/rose-toned base styling (background helpers, text glow/highlight utilities, and typography choices for heading vs body) using Tailwind @layer so both pages share the same theme without inline <style> blocks.

Apply the shared warm/rose theme styling (gradient tones, subtle glow/highlights, consistent typography/spacing) to the splash page using Tailwind classes and the shared utilities from frontend/src/index.css.
Ensure the main page uses the same warm/rose theme tokens/utility classes (typography, spacing, subtle glow accents) and avoids introducing blue/purple primary elements.

Extend Tailwind theme configuration as needed for Rose Day-specific animations/utilities (e.g., named keyframes/animations for float/fall) while keeping the overall palette warm/rose-toned (no blue/purple as primary).
